entry.title: PyOhio 2011: Multi-player Games using Panda3D and Python
entry.summary:
Description

Multi-player Games using Panda3D and Python

Presented by Peter Carswell

This two-hour tutorial is designed to investigate the implementation of a multi-player game using the game engine Panda3D. Panda3D's intended game- development language is Python. The concepts involve Object Oriented Programming structures, modeling and texture mapping, key-binding motion, collisions and, finally, networking techniques.

entry.title: Develop Games with Panda3D and Python
entry.summary:
Summary

In the brief amount of time available, this tutorial will take a simple game concept and implement a multi-player game. Game development with Panda3D will consist of writing a Python program that controls the Panda3D library. Computer lab projects will provide hands-on experience investigating the various components of a network game.
